predictions.text: ICE Brent crude oil (front-month) will settle at or above $100.00/bbl at least once by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if the ICE Brent front-month futures official daily settlement price is >= 100.00 USD/bbl on any trading day on or before 2026-09-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Red Sea/Gulf shipping disruption headlines (missile/drone attacks, insurance rate spikes)
OPEC+ meeting outcomes and compliance commentary
EIA weekly inventory surprises and OECD stock levels
Options-implied skew for Brent calls (risk premium steepening)
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical volatility and fragile regional security can reprice crude risk premium quickly, even without sustained supply loss; $100 is reachable on shock days but not the base case.

predictions.text: TrendForce/DRAMeXchange will report that average server DRAM contract prices increased by at least 15% quarter-over-quarter for any quarter in 2026 H1 or 2026 Q3, published by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if a TrendForce/DRAMeXchange pricing update explicitly states (in text or table) that average server DRAM contract prices rose >=15% QoQ for a named quarter (e.g., 2026Q2 vs 2026Q1), and the update is published on or before 2026-09-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: HBM allocation tightness and lead-time extensions cited by OEMs/cloud providers
Micron/SK hynix/Samsung commentary on pricing and supply discipline
AI server shipment forecasts and BOM cost trends
TrendForce weekly/monthly DRAM/NAND spot indicators
predictions.rationale: AI datacenter demand increases memory intensity; contract pricing tends to respond with step-changes during tight cycles, and >=15% QoQ is plausible within 2026.

predictions.text: BLS CPI-U for the category 'computers, peripherals, and smart home assistant devices' will show a positive year-over-year (12-month) percent change (>0.0%) in at least one monthly CPI release by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if any BLS CPI monthly release (published on or before 2026-12-31 UTC) shows the 12-month percent change for 'computers, peripherals, and smart home assistant devices' is > 0.0%.
monitoring_signals: BLS detailed CPI tables for IT hardware subcomponents
PC/smartphone ASP trends and memory pass-through commentary
DRAM/NAND contract price trajectory and GPU supply constraints
Retail electronics promo intensity (seasonal discounting levels)
predictions.rationale: Electronics deflation can reverse if memory and components re-inflate and discounting eases; a single positive YoY print is a moderate-probability outcome over a year.

predictions.text: DHS and/or USCIS will publish a Federal Register Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) that expands mandatory E-Verify usage beyond current federal-contractor requirements, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if the Federal Register publishes an NPRM sponsored by DHS and/or USCIS proposing new mandatory E-Verify requirements for additional employer categories (not merely guidance), on or before 2026-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: DHS Unified Agenda entries referencing E-Verify expansion
White House immigration enforcement directives and agency memos
Congressional hearings/legislation that could be paired with rulemaking
Employer-compliance rulemaking activity in the Federal Register
predictions.rationale: If the policy agenda prioritizes lowering unauthorized employment, E-Verify expansion is a logical lever, but rulemaking bandwidth and legal risk keep probability modest.

predictions.text: The DOJ Antitrust Division or FTC will publicly announce a settlement/consent agreement that ends at least one active U.S. federal antitrust lawsuit against a major tech platform (Alphabet/Google, Meta, Amazon, Apple, or Microsoft) by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if DOJ or FTC issues a press release (or the defendant files an 8-K) announcing a settlement/consent decree/stipulated dismissal that resolves at least one pending federal antitrust case against one of the named platforms, on or before 2026-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Court docket activity indicating settlement talks (joint status reports, continuances)
Changes in DOJ/FTC leadership priorities and remedy posture
Public statements about narrowing claims or remedy negotiations
Earnings-call references to litigation resolution timelines
predictions.rationale: Shifts in enforcement priorities and litigation fatigue often produce at least one negotiated resolution in a multi-case portfolio within a year, though not guaranteed.

predictions.text: South Korea’s Personal Information Protection Commission (PIPC) will announce an administrative fine/penalty against Coupang for the reported data breach totaling at least KRW 50 billion, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if the PIPC publishes a press release/decision naming Coupang and stating an administrative fine/penalty >= 50,000,000,000 KRW related to the incident, on or before 2026-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: PIPC investigation updates and committee meeting agendas
Korean press reporting on provisional findings and proposed penalties
Coupang regulatory risk disclosures in filings and earnings calls
Parallel actions by Korea Fair Trade Commission or prosecutors
predictions.rationale: Large consumer-platform breaches increasingly draw sizeable penalties; however, final amounts and timing depend on investigation conclusions and appeal processes.

predictions.text: The U.S. government will publicly announce a pause, suspension, or reduction of at least $50 million in planned security/counternarcotics assistance to Colombia (named programs or aggregated amount), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if an official U.S. government statement (State/White House/USAID/DoD) or published budget/notifications explicitly indicates a pause/suspension/reduction totaling >= $50M for Colombia security/counternarcotics assistance, on or before 2026-06-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: State/Foreign Ops budget releases and congressional notification letters
Bilateral diplomatic disputes and public rhetoric spikes
Reporting on DEA/INL cooperation changes or program hold notices
Conditions-based aid language in appropriations/authorization text
predictions.rationale: Political tensions can spill into conditionality and aid timing; still, formal reductions at this size face interagency and congressional friction.

predictions.text: The EU (Council of the European Union) will adopt a new Syria-related restrictive-measures package designating at least 10 individuals and/or entities in a single action, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if the Council of the EU issues a press release and/or Official Journal publication showing Syria restrictive measures with >=10 new listings adopted on the same date, on or before 2026-06-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: EU Foreign Affairs Council agendas referencing Syria
UN/NGO reporting on escalations, repression, or mass-casualty events
UK/US coordination signals on Syria sanctions
Leak/preview reporting from Brussels correspondents (Reuters/FT)
predictions.rationale: Renewed violence and instability often trigger incremental listings; reaching 10+ in one tranche is plausible but contingent on a clear attribution narrative.

predictions.text: A top U.S. quick-service or fast-casual restaurant company (McDonald's, Yum! Brands, Restaurant Brands International, Wendy’s, or Chipotle) will state in an earnings call transcript, press release, or SEC filing that a national 'value' platform (e.g., value menu/meal deal) is planned to continue through at least 2026-12-31, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified true if one named company explicitly states (in transcript/press release/10-Q/8-K) that a nationwide value menu/meal-deal platform will continue 'through 2026' or through a date >= 2026-12-31, with the statement published on or before 2026-09-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Company earnings call commentary on traffic drivers and promo calendars
Menu pricing actions and franchisee margin discussions
Consumer spending/restaurant traffic data (NPD/Black Box/Kalibrate)
Competitive moves (copycat value offers) indicating a prolonged value cycle
predictions.rationale: If consumers remain price-sensitive, chains tend to institutionalize value platforms; explicit multi-quarter guidance through year-end 2026 is plausible but not assured.
